Stock

Class Stock

  • java.lang.Object
    • Stock.Stock

  • public class Stock
extends java.lang.Object
    This class represents a collection of items organised by Items and its quantity. Can be used for Store Inventory, Stock Orders, Sales Logs, and Truck Cargo.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Kwun Hyo Lee & Jonathan Wai

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Stock()
      Constructs a new Stock object, representing a collection of Items.

      Gets the quantity of the given Item in the Stock.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Stock

        public Stock()
        Constructs a new Stock object, representing a collection of Items. Instantiates a LinkedHashMap of Items as the Key and Integer as the Value. The Stock object represents an Item and its corresponding Quantity. The Stock object can be used for: Store Inventory, Stock Orders, Sales Logs, Truck Cargos

    • Method Detail

      • addStock

        public void addStock(Item item,
                     int quantity)
        Adds a given quantity to the corresponding Item in the Stock LinkedHashMap. If the stock does not contain the specific Item, the Item will be added to the LinkedHashMap as a new Key and will be provided the input quantity.
        Parameters:
        item - Name of the Item
        quantity - Quantity of the Item to add

      • removeStock

        public void removeStock(Item item,
                        int quantity)
                 throws StockException
        Removes a given quantity from the corresponding Item in the Stock LinkedHashMap. If the Item has a lower quantity than the input quantity, a StockException will be thrown with the message, "Not enough Stock".
        Parameters:
        item - Name of the Item
        quantity - Quantity of the Item to remove
        Throws:
        StockException

      • addTwoStocks

        public void addTwoStocks(Stock newStock)
        Adds the quantity of Items in the input Stock (param Stock) to the current Stock.
        Parameters:
        newStock - Stock to add to the given Stock

      • removeTwoStocks

        public void removeTwoStocks(Stock newStock)
                     throws StockException
        Removes the quantity of Items in the input Stock (param Stock) from the current Stock.
        Parameters:
        newStock - Stock to remove from the given Stock
        Throws:
        StockException

      • getStock

        public java.util.LinkedHashMap<Item,java.lang.Integer> getStock()
        Gets the current Stock
        Returns:
        A LinkedHashMap of the Stock

      • getQuantity

        public int getQuantity(Item item)
        Gets the quantity of the given Item in the Stock. Returns 0 if the item does not exist.
        Returns:
        Quantity of item in the current Stock

      • sortStockByTemperature

        public java.util.LinkedHashMap<Item,java.lang.Integer> sortStockByTemperature()
        Sorts the current Stock by Item temperature in lowest to highest temperature order.
        Returns:
        A LinkedHashMap sorted by temperature in ascending order.
